lines.text: February 23rd, 1972. We buried Lt. Johnson today. Finally. But his spirit feels very much alive here. In this town, his men and me. I came here as one kind of person and leaving as another. Together with his family and his men, I think we made a difference. I know Dwight Johnson did.
Major Laird, are you always pontual to the very minute?
Yes, ma'am. I'm well trained by U.S. Army.
"Be kind. Nearly everyone is fighting a hard battle. And not just on the battlefield".

Sometimes, it takes one person, making one move and opening people's eyes. It's hard to be that one person but when the time comes and you know it, you just say "Yes, this is it. It's me who has to do this".
Justice is an idea, it's not real. Family it's real.
